structural_analysis.context_justification: The document starts with the header 'तृतीयः प्रश्नः' (Third Prashna) and the first verse is numbered '।।१।।'. Therefore, the starting coordinate is 3.1.
structural_analysis.filename_justification: Combines the grantha ID ('prashna-upanishad'), a slug for the commentator ('rangaramanuja'), and the zero-padded starting ID ('03-01') for unique, sortable file naming.

proposed_strategy.name: Validated Group by Character Count
proposed_strategy.description: This strategy combines consecutive major sections (Prashnas), strictly ensuring no chunk exceeds the safety character limit. The plan is regenerated internally if any proposed chunk is too large.

execution_plan.description: The entirety of the Third Prashna.

parsing_instructions.justification: The Prashna is the top-level division in this document, and it is internally divided by Mantras. Each Mantra, consisting of the original verse and its commentary, is the logical unit for parsing.
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: Extract the Devanagari numeral(s) enclosed between '।।' and '।।' at the end of the bolded Mantra line.

start_pattern.description: A new Mantra begins with a line of bolded Sanskrit text that concludes with its number enclosed in double dandas (।।...।।).
examples: **अथ हैनं कौसल्यश्चाऽऽश्वलायन: पप्रच्छ । भगवन् ! कुत एष प्राणो जायते । कथमायात्यस्मिन् शरीरे । आत्मानं वा प्रविभज्य कथं ‘प्रतितिष्ठते । केनोत्क्रमते । कथं बाह्यमभिधत्ते । कथमध्यात्ममिति ।।१।।**
**तस्मै स होवाच – अतिप्रश्नान् पृच्छसि ब्रह्मिष्ठोऽसीति तस्मात् तेऽहं ब्रवीमि ।।२।।**

end_pattern.description: A Mantra section ends just before the start of the next Mantra's start pattern or at the final colophon of the entire Prashna.

pre_content_handling.instruction: The content between the main 'Prashna' header and the first Mantra, specifically '**[****प्राणकार्यभेदाः****]', should be parsed as a thematic sub-heading for the Third Prashna.
